'''Anaconda''' is the installer for [[Red Hat Linux]] and [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]]. It is written in [[Python (programming language)|Python]] and [[C (programming language)|C]], with a graphical frontend using [[PyGTK]] and a text frontend using [[python-newt]]. A [[Kickstart (Linux)|kickstart]] file can be used to automatically configure the installation, allowing users to run it with minimal supervision.
+
'''Anaconda''' is the installer for [[Red Hat Linux]] and [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]]. It is written in [[Python (programming language)|Python]] and [[C (programming language)|C]], with a graphical frontend using [[PyGTK]] and a text frontend using [[python-newt]]. A [[Kickstart (Linux)|kickstart]] file can be used to automatically configure the installation, allowing users to run it with minimal supervision.
Anaconda installer is used by RHEL,fedora and a number of other projects, Anaconda offers a text-mode and GUI mode, so users can install on a wide range of systems.
Anaconda installer is used by RHEL,fedora and a number of other projects, Anaconda offers a text-mode and GUI mode, so users can install on a wide range of systems.
